alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Johnson, northwestern Floyd and northeastern Magoffin Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marshallville, or near Salyersville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Brief torrential downpours and wind gusts in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Conley, Mashfork and Brainard around 740 PM EDT. Falcon and Dotson around 745 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Riceville, Swamp Branch, Ballot, Bonanza, Dobson, Niles, Patrick, Leander, Oil Springs, Cliff, Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Denver, Fitz, Collista, Hagerhill, Staffordsville, East Point, Barnetts Creek and West Van Lear. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 3. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 16 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
